review: Food here is fine--typical chain experience, and I like a few of the burger and sandwich options. Also can't beat bottomless fries, if that's a thing for you. Where Red Robin locations either excel or fall short is on the service experience, and this location in Bothell is all over the map on service. We've experienced some pretty amazing service now and then, but more often, the experience is just MEH. Middle-of-the-road at best, but often bordering on indifferent. Our most recent experience was on the lower end of the scale. We were seated for about ten minutes before our server appeared--seemed like our table wasn't in his actual section, but he'd been assigned to us maybe because the restaurant was slower that day and they were doing a round-robin type of thing on assigning servers to tables instead of seating people in each server's section. When our server did stop by, the initial experience was fine, with the usual ordering of drinks and food, but that's where things slipped fully into MEH mode. We saw our server just twice more after that, when he stopped by to check on drink refills and clear plates and later to drop off our check. He was phased shortly after that and didn't bother to stop at our table to tell us he was leaving and/or if anyone else would be checking on us. It was purely chance that I saw him leave the restaurant so I knew he was done for the day. The restaurant itself is generally clean, but if you look closely at the ledges beneath the shutters they use to divide the entry space from the dining room, you'll see a layer of dust that indicates some surfaces may not have seen a cleaning (or even a quick wiping down) in at least many days and possibly weeks or months. We've never had a problem with food quality here, and the service issues haven't required a direct discussion with management, nor have they affected our tipping. But we never come to this location with an expectation of an all-around excellent experience, it's typically a pretty functional visit to have a meal because we're hungry and Red Robin sounded good or was convenient for us.

It's Red Robin. You get your typical burger, brew & fry experience in a laid-back environment. However, in this particular location, the staff just doesn't seem interested in making your visit memorable, it seems like they just want to get through their shift. It's not particularly fast service, the bottomless fries come with just a dozen fries each time. I suppose that's prudent on their part (money-saving), but it comes across as cheap. Maybe the first serving could be larger, then scale back on the serving size. Also, when travelling with the little kids, always deliver their food first, no matter if the rest of the table's order is complete, or at least ask if that's what the adults prefer. The restroom was not clean, and I hate that there was only a single soap dispenser on the wall for both sinks. That means if you use the far sink you have to wait for the other person at the other sink to move out of the way before you can finish washing your hands.  There are better Red Robins to visit.

I used to love Red Robin, but no longer. The service was so slow, it took forever to get our meal. Our server came realizing the food was taking long and offered to bring us fries. We were offered sauces with our fries and then were charged .75 cents a piece for them. Over-priced for a tiny piece of meat inside our bun even after being told the specialty burgers we ordered were supposed to be bigger than normal burgers on the menu. We split two burgers and my husband was like where's the meat? We ordered medium well and it came out over done and crispy. Then the manager proceeded to the table behind us and profusely apologized for the slowness and gave them a discount, but we were not treated the same. Our server was friendly and have nothing against her. I feel bad for the table of 20 that came in as we were leaving.

Ordered a BLTA to go with no turkey or bacon. They still charged me the same price even though I asked for no meat. Usually other restaurants charge less if you omit meat. Then to top it all off, the avocados in my sandwich were rotten and I had to pick them off! I called and complained and was told I would receive a gift card in the mail. I have received nothing. It is completely unacceptable to serve rotten food to customers!

My husband and I love Red Robin, however, we came across a terrible experience at the Bothell Red Robin. My husband asked for the beef patty to have no pink and we get a beef patty that is fully pink. We called them up as we ordered the food to go, to tell them the beef patty was totally raw and the person who answered the phone, Ben, laughed at us and was utterly rude. We asked to speak to the manager who apologized, but that is horrible customer service. On top of that, I ordered the clucks and fries, and immediately after eating them I threw up and was sick for 4 days straight. Had to go to the doctor and found out I had severe food poisoning from the clucks and fries. We will never be going back to this location ever again!

Normally I really like going to Red Robin. Not today. I understand that you should expect a bit of a wait if there is a large party at the same time. However, it should never take 1.5 hours to get a burger and a kids Mac n' cheese. Having to ask 3 times for the birthday boys milkshake was rediculous, the blank stare with no response was disturbing. We were left wondering if it would ever show up. Once the table next to us started arguing over weather or not to leave before they got their food, I realized it wasn't just me with a bad experience. Probably won't be coming back to this Red Robin in the extended future.

Consistently good burgers.   My usual fare is the value priced Reds Tavern Double which also comes with bottomless fries.  Top that off with a 50-50 mix of Mannys and Mac & Jack's makes it the perfect bar meal.   Although they no longer have the spicy chicken sandwich on the menu, they're more than happy to prep it for you.   I also suggest the BLTA Croissant Sandwich, so tasty!  I've found all the Red Robin's to be very accommodating for large groups, and still offer premium service.   Large parking lot is a plus, but it can get a little crowded around dinner and weekends.

Typically, most RR places that I go to are often a hit or miss. I will say, this location was a hit :)  Came here with a party of seven and we got seated promptly without much wait on a Friday during lunch. Our server was quite attentive and overall, provided great service to our party. Table was clean, water was always filled and it was nice to munch on a basket of fries while we waited for the food.  When we did receive our food, it was hot and fresh. Another win win since usually, I get lukewarm to cold food at other locations. I like my whiskey wrap and it served to be a nice food coma afternoon.  Definitely will swing by here again for future lunches.

Now that we have kids, we tend to go to family friendly restaurants. Kids can grab a red balloon by the entrance, always a plus as it keeps them entertain for a bit during dinner. We prefer Bothell location as it's much cleaner and newer. Other locations, (Bellevue square) the floors and high chairs are sticky, my shoe literally sticks on the floor but that's for another review.  As for thrashers corner Bothell, the servers are nice and checks up on us pretty frequent, making sure we have enough fries, sauces etc. I love the mushroom burger, you can also substitute sides if you rather have sweet potatoes or a salad! BLTA crossiant sandwich is another fav. They have a good variety for kids meal, from burgers to mac and cheese, chicken strips, mini corn dogs etc, and they come with a drink or Kids can upgrade to milkshake.

Even though I typically do not prefer eating in chain restaurants, I'm quite a fan of this one. It's because these restaurants can please anybody - from a huge meat fan to vegans and their menu is full of goodies. As a pescatarian, I really appreciate having an option to turn any burger into vegetarian or vegan one. You can literally create your own delicious burger. I love that!

This place is a hit or miss as far as service goes. Just depending on how busy they are. I think more training or more staff is needed to handle the crowd.  I always get the whiskey chicken sandwhich and my husband some type of cheeseburger. I love how moist the chicken breast is. Everytime I order my sandwhich as a wrap the kitchen staff does a great job of wrapping the chicken in at least two layers of iceberg lettuce because they know one layer is a little too thin.  My husband likes his cheeserburgers. A burger that's in between Mcdonalds and John Howie. Especially when you're hungry, it'sthe most amazing burger or sandwhich. If you don't fill your stomach with the burger or sandwhich you also get bottomless fries. All the French fries your heart desires. The price of a burger or sandwhich is around $11-$15 makes it a good value.  Join the loyalty program. Every 10th item free and free birthday burger.  This is my go to place for America food that won't break the bank.

Great server (named Jesse) and good food.  I like being able to run in,  grab drinks,  appetizers,  or lunch,  and have fast service.  Drinks were good...we had our usually vodka shots,  vodka tonics,  and chardonnay (yeah. ..not a wine drinker myself). Had the Berserker burger (again) because. ...HELLO. ..I think it's YUM! !! Apparently when I was at the Everett RR...the waitress never actually swiped my rewards card...when I purchased 6 entrees. ...so we didn't get our free burger that I was expecting.  The manager came out to talk to me and offered to honor a free burger. ..but we had already paid.  That was really nice of her. ...and we do always get better service in Bothell!  Red Robin. .... ....Yum!

Came here for drinks with my husband last night. The service was great. They took our drink order and had it out in a jiffy. My husband and I watched the poker game that was going on the tv. We sat in the bar area and it was very nice. Would definitely come here again.

My 4 year old son and I came here tonight after the trampoline park, so he was hungry.  I totally understand how busy a Red Robin is around 7 on a Saturday night.  20 minute wait, no big deal.  Take a while to greet us and bring us waters and silverware, ok.  Food finally arrives and forget our sauces, still happy.  I always ask for more fries right when they bring the food, since they only give you 5-7 fries to begin with and they know you will ask for more.  This is where I get angry.  Let's just say 30 minutes goes by (not joking) and we still don't have more fries.  I had asked 3 severs for them during that 30 minutes.  I even paid on that silly computer they have on the table that does 60% of their job for them.....still no fries.  Finally my original server arrives to say the kitchen is really backed up, but he knows we want more fries and is working on it.   Too late!  I'm pissed.  My suggestion is to either give people enough fries to begin with or hire a guy who's sole purpose is to cook fries all night.  If I hadn't manually paid on the self serve computer I would've asked for the tip back!

Utterly disappointing. Came in at 1:30 for a birthday family birthday lunch at the request of the lovely birthday girl. Right off the bat, service was slow. It took quite a bit of time before we got our drinks; and when the waiter brought them, he delivered everyone's drink except mine (which was on the tray) and then proceeded to start taking food orders. My husband had to reach over and get my drink off of the serving tray while our server was at the other end of the table. As we were a large party and wanted several separate checks, the waiter made a point to have us order based on the grouping of the checks vs where we sat at the table, to avoid any confusion.  The food took AGES to come out. We did not order anything extraordinary. No special requests or substitutions. 10 adult meals and 2 kids meals. We specifically requested for the kids meals to come out as soon as they were up in the window because our kids eat slow, and also because they were super hungry. We do this almost everywhere we go and we've never had a problem. Today, it was well over 25 minutes between placing our order and receiving the kids meals, despite our server assuring us that he would bring their meals out quickly. 10 minutes after that, the adult meals came out. The manager stopped by to offer a token apology for how long our food was taking telling us thay about 6 parties came in at the same time, and wr just happened to be the last one in, so basically we got the short end of the stick. The food was cold. It was very obvious that our plates had sat in the window for quite some time. My mother in law and I ordered the french onion soup, which came out luke-warm. The cheese on top was so congealed that both of us had to saw through it with a knife. The BLTA croissant was bland, the croissant tasted stale, and the rest of the ingredients were just tasteless. Then came time to settle the bills. Two in our party received a bill which totaled five dollars and some change. When the server brought their receipt back for signature, they had been charged THIRTY SEVEN dollars. The manager again came by to tell them that because we had "so many" separate checks there had been a mix up. I call bs on that, because multiple separate checks does not explain how their first receipt was for 5 and change and the one they were presented to sign was over 37. The rest of us hadn't even asked for our checks yet as we were still plowing through our cold food. Once the rest of us got our checks, more drama ensued. Two in our group were using their rewards cards to cash in their free birthday meal. Our server came back and was VERY condescending and argumentative with the birthday folk who were trying to use their rewards.  Overall it just left a bad taste in my mouth. I consistently have terrible experiences at this location, yet we keep coming back, hoping it will be different. Frankly, I'm tired of it, and I'm pretty darn tired of Red Robin. The food is bland, the service is awful, and the prices keep going up. Not worth the time or effort.

Best experience I have ever had at a Red Robin. Decided to go out to lunch chose this location because it was close to my work and it sounded good. On my way there I ran over something that just so happened to get stuck under my car. It was super stuck. Went in ordered of course the waiter was great maybe his name D- Rex.... while eating the manager came by asked how everything was and I mentioned my car and the thing being stuck, he asked for us to go check it out. He got on the ground and crawled under my car and pulled it out! Thanks so much Andy not many people would do that!!! You are obviously great at what you do because all the staff was friendly and smiling and very cheerful. This will be my Red Robin. Your boss should feel very lucky to have a gentleman as a general manager

Food quality has really gone downhill.  It's  more like a glorified McDonald's now with tons of little kids. My fish sandwich tasted like a frost bitten reheated soggy mess with expired slaw. Fries were cold and mushy.  Not gourmet anything.  Won't be back. Many other better options around.

We had pretty good service last night. Total bill $49. My husband liked his bacon burger and I had the avocado burger with sweet potato fries. The servings were big enough for me to pack half up for later, although I'm not sure how it's gonna taste as left overs. Pretty busy for a Monday night. Ps- onion ring tower is a must have-- my kids go crazy over how tall it is!

My review is about the service not the food because the waiter never showed up to take our order! So we come in and are seated. The kid (waiter) shows up and we asked him to give us a minute to decide. 5 minutes goes, 10 minute goes, I call the waiter with the stupid screen or tablet they have at the tables, nothing, 15 minutes goes and no signs of him. We saw him roaming around in the kitchen. The restaurant wasn't even busy.   Three other families came after us, and their orders were taken by different waiters.  So we ended up leaving to a different restaurant.  Very disappointing and awful service!

We rolled into this dirty bird on a Sunday afternoon, and sat ourselves in the bar. Both the husband and I are well-versed in their menu and are generally ready to order as soon as we walk in. This location was either understaffed or people were out of their section, as it took almost 7min to get a menu tossed onto our table (without being acknowledged, while the waitress was talking over her shoulder to a coworker), and then another 5min for her to come back and take our order. Not a huge deal, just enough to be unsettling. Husband was distracted the entire time by Planet of the Apes/Cougartown (such a strange combo..)  playing on the tvs behind me.  Food arrived just after we both started to wonder where it was at, and both entrees were hot and tasty. My portion of the bottomless fries was a little sad, but I'll live. Waitress came by once more during this process to ensure we knew how to check out using their tableside tablet before disappearing.  Meh on service and food was the standard. Nothing keeping us from coming back.

This review is for a lunch hour pick up. I unfortunately already added a tip when I purchased the order online. They forgot the milkshake which made us have to go back after driving away. The California Chicken burger had soggy lettuce and brown guacamole.  Very little fries were added and what was included appeared to be hours old. The sad kids meals were atrocious.  The so called chocolate milk was warm milk in a plastic cup with unstirred chocolate syrup at the bottom. We will not attempt to eat at this establishment again. $33 tossed in the garbage. Literally.

I never write bad reviews, but I cannot believe how horrible the service was. First off, they made it seem like a burden that I didn't want to sit in the bar. After they sat me, it took nearly 15 minutes for someone to even acknowledge my existence. Plus the place wasn't even at half capacity or busy. When the waiter finally came he was super dismissive and again acted like I was a burden. The whole ambience of the restaurant staff was passive aggressive as if no one wanted to be there. People all around me were experiencing the same thing. We all caused an uproar with upper management and still nothing changed... after 45 minutes without even a glass of water or a napkin I walked out.

Celebration:  seated immediately at the bar.  I loved the self-service iPad-type device on each table. You can even select an option to call the server.  Wish we had seen this little option on their menu:  it's on the top right of the screen!  Because we were trying to catch our waiter's attention for a while. But 5 stars for the convenient technology touch.  From here you can view your rewards, or sign up if you haven't already, play games ( there's a $1.99 charge for unlimited games), view the menu and re-order drinks.  Less than stellar service. With the call server button, there is no incentive for the wait staff to stop by or even look our way.  Food delivered and no silverware.  Water no ice and it came with ice.  Gourmet mushroom burger.  Delicious!  Steak fries - delicious.  Bottomless - does this get any better?!

We ate here last Sunday night with a large church group.  I was surprised at how quickly our food came and all was cooked to our specifications.  The server actually bowed his head to pray with our group before we ate, and I appreciated that:)  When we are going to Red Ribin as a family,  we often choose this one, even though there is one closer to our house, because it is always clean, the service is friendly and prompt. Will keep coming back here!
Had an awesome dinner tonight! Food was great, and our server Joe was even better. He was charismatic and extremely attentive. Next time I come to this location I will defiantly be requesting him!

One of my fav locations for Red Robin. Always easy to get in and out of. Staff is super friendly and food is consistent and good.  I love the new Smoke & Pepper well it's been around for a year nearly but still my fav. Really good burger and flavors. I really don't have any complaints. I love the way this one is layed out and really open. It's great!  I'll be back for sure whenever I'm in the area and have a mood for a burger.  Their other food at all locations is sub-par in my opinion except for the chicken wraps and soup. I've had seafood basket, fish & chips, and other things that just seem really microwaved and 2 star, but their burgers are really good with rare exception depending on location. This location just has an extra edge on service and food. Not sure why but highly recommend.  Thanks

Ordered a few items on door dash, the order had not been accepted so I called and the lady answering the phone  was VERY rude. I had then got my items and the milkshakes were only half filled. I was very disappointed.

This was supposed to be a quick lunch out with a new hire.  Welcome aboard, get to know you kind of thing.  We were seated promptly, got our menus and waited.  After about 5 minutes a server stopped by to say someone would be with us shortly.  No worries.  10 minutes later someone else came back to take our drink order.  No, we're ready.  We ordered a couple of Cobb salads, not an exotic item.  Apparently there is an egg shortage so the hard boiled egg is $1 extra. Fine, no problem.  No cukes though please.  Then we find out there are no hard boiled eggs at all, but they'll hard fry one hard for us. No thanks.  Food comes out with extra cukes and no blue cheese on one, no dressing with the other.  Not what we ordered.   To their credit the manager came by to check on us and we explained the  problems with our orders.  He agreed it wasn't that complicated and promptly brought out the missing items.  Beginning to end was 75 minutes on a not very busy lunch day.  The food itself was fine, but service and execution in the kitchen were problems.

It must just be an overall all red robin thing. I have come here a couple time. The first time was a nice breath of fresh air from my local Everett one which is just HORRIBLE. Staff was amazing and food was AMAZING. Second time was not that impressed and thrid time i was like ok here we go again. Red Robin just needs to get their chain under control. These resturants are just fastly going down hill. Wont return! If you want a good burger in the Bothell area stay on Bothell Everett Hwy going South and try the Ranch burgers! Cute little stop in place! And food is great!

Went back to this Red Robin today. Piss poor still. They were slow, didn't listen to our order at all. I asked for more fries and it took ten minutes and we only got six fries in the basket. Those machines things they make you pay with are stupid too. The printer always jams and they are lame. A waiter is supposed to do that. If the machine is going to do their job should I tip less?

The waitress at this Red Robin restaurant did a horrible job, she did not get us silver ware, did not get our food even though the food was prepared. This kind of behavior is not acceptable. I would give this place negative stars if I could. The management made bad choices in hiring and they need to know ethics.

This place is awesome. Service was great if you come to this location ask to be seated in Ryan Hardi section. He's has wonderful service he took care of me and my girlfriend and  made us feel welcome.
RR is not as good as it used to be. Food is still ok. Blazing Onion has better quality burgers.

The remodel wrecked this Red Robin.  I used to meet my husband here weekly for lunch and would order the $14.00 Smoke and Pepper burger.  It came with premium bacon to partially justify the price.  In addition, the service was always really great.  Now, several things have changed:  they have these little computers on the table that they expect you to use to pay or call your server; they are putting "homemade" pepper bacon-essentially regular bacon that they have covered in pepper-on the burger and calling it good; the service is so slow it takes 2 hours to eat lunch at this red robin. It's unacceptable to do a bait and switch on the burger when you are charging $14 for it. It's unacceptable to make people wait so long for their lunch. It's unacceptable to replace adequate staffing with little tabletop computers. Go to another Red Robin.  Don't waste your time and money here.

Food is great, cooks and waiters are generally awesome. But I'm sorry, Red Robin. The Front Line to customers is the first impression. I'm waiting for my takeout and there are two hostesses. One just danced all over the waiting area spraying victoria's secret love spell and the other is too busy looking in a mirror applying lip gloss instead of greeting customers. What is happening???

location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
review: Red Robin always over promises and under-delivers. The burgers always look great in the menu but you start to feel nauseous about half way through. Patties are too thick and flavors are too strong. It's greasy, gross and they still play Hootie and the Blowfish, but hey, they can accommodate large groups.

Been going for years to Red Robin mostly to the Lynnwood one but since Bothell was built we have been going to this one. Went on Friday 21rst and must have been a off night my Royal burger didn't taste like it always has. Same with the wifes burger she said was just ok not as good as she has before. My drink was always kept full without saying anything not this time, probably the first time this has happened. The fries well over cooked and hard. Not happy spent 80.00 dollars with drinks hardly any booze in my wifes drink but my daughter's drink was good. Its like we lost a good friend that always came thru. And it wasn't busy on this trip 6:30 pm, it always was before around this time especially on a Friday.

It started at the door! Hostess could not find an open table amongst the many vacant tables! We sat and watched two tables next to us order and receive their food. Are food of course arrived after about 35 minutes....and it was COLD!  The check of course came immediately upon request! One star for the Bruchetta Sandwich. It was good.

We have been loyal customers since 2002 when we moved to Redmond. We recently moved to Mill Creek area and visited several times to the Bothell location. Its was smaller than Redmond but bigger in customer service! Food here is amazing, my Royal Cheeseburger was the best I ever had!  Christopher was the star of our visit. We felt so at home and well cared for. Our second visit we had Amanda and she was so courteous as well and my coke was always full. Which for me is a big plus!!  We were also greeted by Isis (hope I Spelled that right) the mgr which was so nice. Bothell Red Robin is our new dinner spot and highly recommend to be your burger hot spot too!

Who would have thought they could get worse. If you must go to a robin I suggest Lynnwood or Woodinville. We had over an hour wait for cold food that Sat in the window to long. We got excuse after excuse from our server and the manager. Then they charged one of our party 37$ on a 5$ check. To top it all off the server argued with the birthday girl about the rewards card. I hope he enjoyed his horrible tip. First time I haven't tipped in many years that's how bad it was.
Always very very good in every way! We come here often because it is close to our home. Definitely better than other Red Robins in terms of service.

We might be lucky (because I'm definitely not patient) but we always have really good service at this location. The servers always give us extra fries before the meal to keep our kids happy, they're always quick and friendly.

It's Red Robin...it's a chain, and so - it's consistent. I love their fries...they are the BIG cut fries, and they are crispy on the outside!  You can also request a number of different dipping sauces to try with the fries...and get ready...the best part is they are BOTTOMLESS!!  That's right, you can just tell your server - to "keep 'em comin'" I don't generally stray too much from my regular items, I love the French Onion Soup (it has melted provolone & parmesan, and is served with garlic focaccia),  If I order the soup, I always get a side of fries...because well...ya know, I like fries. The other item I order is the A1 Peppercorn Burger (bacon, melted Pepper-Jack, A.1.® Peppercorn Spread, tomatoes and crispy onion straws on an onion bun). - $10.99 and it comes with BOTTOMLESS fries. :) Here are some pics, of the fries, French Onion Soup, and the Chicken Strips Kids Meal. :) Not hungry?  Just pop in for a cocktail - They have a number of them on the menu, some of them even contain ice cream.  Ya know,... like a boozy milkshake!!  Hello? - perfect for HOT summer days!

Very good burgers! This is the go to place for my husband ALL the time! Service is usually Great! Recently that is. It has improved a lot because servers used to be super rude and not attentive ! Last couple times I've had GREAT servers!!!

I'm not really a fan of the kind of food they serve, I have no idea why, but to be honest red robin really stepped up their game. Way better than Applebee's, that's for sure. Lmfao. And plus they got these cool tablets you can pay, order, and play games on

We stop in to have lunch the other day. I will say it's been a year or so since I have been there. It was disappointing I ordered the avocado bacon burger,as soon as I got my order I noticed the burger had been downsized from the last time I was there. The fries were cold,I'll say warm not hot.. The avocado wasn't..It was a thin spread of guacamole on the bun. What a joke. I definitely will not be back!

After a brief wait, my cousin and I were seated at a cozy booth! We were promptly visited by our waitress who got our drink orders going. Food came out perfectly delicious, and left happy! Very good Red Robin experience.

Came here about a week ago with two friends, and to start off, it wasn't really our first choice anyways. We were seated after waiting just a few minutes, the hostess was VERY kind and she made the experience worth the stars I gave. We were seated in a booth but it didn't feel like one and we were surrounded by a weird ambience that I didn't enjoy-- near the front so we saw all the employees and every person who walked in and in just an awkward place in the restaurant. We started ordering our food and at first, our server seemed very nice however my friend wanted to try one of the lemonades and the server made it sound like she'd just get a refill of another choice if she ended up not liking the new flavor she was trying. Needless to say, she tried making it seem as if that refill would be free but it wasn't and that ticked us off. Secondly, we waited for our food for a good 30-40 minutes and when it came out, it was BARELY warm; my fries were cold that I ended not even eating them. The food was eh but what can you expect coming to a Red Robin really. Maybe if the service was better, it would've been a better experience but we left feeling cheated and not satisfied.

I usually don't give out 5 stars on any review, but this restaurant earned it.  Our waitress was excellent.  All food for our party of 7 was great! Service was both fast and friendly, even when we added other items to our original order more than 5 minutes after it was put in. Instead of anyone giving is that "oh please" look, they gladly added what we wanted.  Only little slip up was that they accidentally gave us the wrong check, but that was easily fixed.  Good food + good service + a friendly staff = a good review.

Just love this place, no really! We come in after a rather wretched meeting and are treated like long-lost friends. To say that Doreen and Mikaela are a delight would be an understatement!  The place is rocking (and it's Thursday, who knew?) and yet they treat everyone quickly and with great smiles, hurray!   The food is terrific, of course! But the service? Fabulous!  If I owned a restaurant I would steal these gals away in a minute!

I have ordered take-out twice at the Bothell location and the food is NOT GOOD!!  The first time I order the BLTA croissant. The sandwich was smaller then what I have normally gotten and the croissant was DRY and STALE!! A month later I give it another try and order a BBQ Chix wrap. Once again smaller portion and really skimpy on the serving of fries!! The chix wrap needed more way more filling. I felt like all I was getting bites of was the spinach tortilla!! Uggg never going to this one again!! Alderwood Mall is way better!

when we come to bothell  side RR is my FAVORITE Burger place plus point my kids favorite place too. I love there Whiskey river bbq Burger. Over all we love going here, this place all ways clean, fast service, good food.............

Two stars, and that was because the hostess was nice and held the door for us on the way in. Sat down about 4:30 pm on a Tuesday afternoon. There was a group of four sitting a few tables down in our section that had already been served, but other than that no other people in our section.  It took forever for Stacy, our server, to come over and get our drink order. I'm talking a good 10 minutes, which I didn't understand considering the scarce amount of patrons in the building. Stacy had to be retrieved by our hostess from the kitchen area. Stacy then wandered to an area behind us, no food in tow, then meandered her way to our table. We ordered our drinks, appetizer and food all at once seeing as we had enough time to review the menu multiple times. I always order the grilled cheese and specified after my last visit with this joint that I in fact did not need my sandwich cut in 12ths and that I would prefer not to have my sandwich on a child's plastic plate. Somewhere along the lines that request was lost in translation. The sandwich thankfully came out cut in half, but it was on a star wars plate. As a 35 year old woman I will pass on the cheap plates made for kids. My daughter counted her fries, she had 5. I think I had 8. Stacy never offered my daughter a refill on her lemonade and never once came back to find out how our meal was or to see if we wanted more fries. Typically I am a great tipper, as I too have been a server. It took everything I had to tip her 10%. Red Robin, get your stuff together and train your employees better. Every single time I walk into this particular Red Robin customer service is an issue. Furthermore our food tasted AWFUL tonight. My daughter refused to finish her grilled cheese. Thanks for nothing RR.

Been here a couple times; last visit the service was interstellar, if fact might have been over the top squeeky nice, but we guys love that :) Burgers made to order (love the mushroom burger), endless steak-cut fries, servers on top of drink refills, quick service, did I say friendly waitresses?, tasty, reasonable price for quality.  Wonderfull shakes and innovative drinks (freckled lemonade is my fav) Big screen color TVs scattered around, lots of bling, brass railings, good looking place to eat. Hard for me to give a chain 5-stars, but I might if they keep it up.

Every Red Robin has the same menu but this one has the best bar staff for takeout. They always get our order correct, they all remember me and they always offer some way to make sure we are happy. I come here at least once a week and they are awesome. Other Red Robins in the area really need to come here to see how it's done.
To start with... Lemonade was missing from strawberry lemonade, the bbq chicken burger had tomato ketchup instead of bbq sauce. Last but not the least, they missed one of our orders.

Me and my crew don't look like we have money, so when we go to a fun restaurant there's constant judgement on us and poor service, foods good but the crew there is judgemental, I shouldn't have to hang a 100$ bill from my hat to be treated the same as the rest, looks shouldn't matter.

My boyfriend and I went to red robin at 3:30pm Saturday. The place wasn't very busy. Tons and tons of open tables.  Waited about 25 minutes before being seated. Then waited and waited for our food for 30 mins before we had to ask what was going on, only for them to tell us they lost our order. The manager came out and said if we stuck around we'd get our meal free...we were too irritated and annoyed that we didn't want to wait, plus we were hungry. We wasted our afternoon together all because of the horrible service.   Instead of using the fancy tablets at the table, maybe they should try being fully staffed with real life waiters. UGH!

Service at this location has always been slow and prone to mistakes. But tonight it was the worst: we waited one hour for 3 burgers and 1 mac and cheese - UNACCEPTABLE! The waitress never stopped at our table to explain what was going on, not even after my husband asked her to check. After my kids complained they were starving, I went to check myself. The waitress ran away after eye contact, her co-worker was more eager to hush me than help me, saying that my "making the noise is not useful" - posting negative reviews on every social media outlet I can think of is useful. And stop patronizing is more useful.

When this location first opened, it was the RR that time forgot.  Loved it.  No lines, great service, food that you expect.  Now it is popular - I'm okay with that.  We have been eating here often, and the quality of servers has degraded to the point that we will not be going back to this location again.  We wait too long to put in an order.  We wait WAY too long for food.  The table service - water beverage refills - is good.  It might be the kitchen is slow?  The food is fine - but I don't want to spend two hours there ever.  Management is responsive - they always try to make things right.  But three of the last three visits?  I don't need that much apologizing.  We love the RR for life - but not this location.

I came in hoping I could at least get a burger and hopefully fries .... I am Gluten, Dairy, and Soy free.  Our server was nice but pushy and once I told him that I have several food concerns and wanted to know about a couple items, he got the manager(?) who wasn't very nice. He said I can get a side salad with dressing maybe. He went to go check to see which ones I could have but I never heard back.  I ended up getting the hummus plate which was very sad. The carrots tasted off and there wasn't very much of the other vegetables, but there was a lot of hummus!  My husband ordered a wrap with broccoli on the side for me but they were rubbery.  Still hungry we went over to Five Guys Burgers & Fries and I got a delicious lettuce wrapped burger and fries!

It is always busy when I come here, so expect to wait 10-20min on a busy night. Everybody that works here is really nice and always seem to treat us great. I always like to see what new items they have on their menu. I have never had a bad meal at this location. They usually have 1-2 rotating beer selections that I like to try as well. Usually local beers!

Red Robin is one of my favorite burger places but this place can be busy. If you can get past the wait time you are in for a yummy burger. The staff is friendly and the remodel is much better than the old look. We enjoy sitting in the bar as well on the weekend and love the "take out" option when things get busy at home.   Outdoor seating would be a great addition to this place.

The food is very predictable but the whole concept seems contrived right out of the movie 'Officespace' where the waiter doesn't have enough flair on. But the real downside here is the noise.   Especially evenings and weekends.  The Boeing Field runway is quieter.  On the flipside, this might be ideal for taking that person you really don't like but are obligated to and you won't have to listen to their yammering.

Food was still good but they recently remodeled and seem to have new management.  Not nearly enough waiters and I went on a weeknight.  The service was really slow, 25 minutes for a Kids meal and 2 burgers, the kitchen seems to have taken staff cuts too.  New ordering system is nice but still not enough bodies to move food around.  It used to be much faster service and the same quality food.  Ordering dessert was another 20 minute wait and we cancelled.  I think we'll try another branch next time.

I wished I've read Sheila's comment before visiting this Red Robin. The remodeling took character away from the place and the desktop device took human touch away from the service. And for whatever reason, my ginger ale came after the food has arrived "because it is from the bar and not from the fountain"?!

Only this location can mess up a $14 dollar burger. Said "no pink" so they served it burnt to make sure it was dead. How it shows up stoned cold is a mystery to me. Second and last chance for this location, we will continue to drive to Woodinville's Red Robin for the service they promise.

Microwaved bacon on the bacon burger. Pitiful serving of fries...especially considering the up charge for sweet potato fries. At least at McDonald's the product is consistent. Service was lackluster to say the least. Definite downhill from the RR of yesteryear.

I went to Red Robin for lunch. I have a soft spot for Red Robin but I'm not sure I'll be going back to this location. It took more than 5 minutes for the server to come over to me after I was seated. I kept looking around and there were consistently 2-3 ppl standing over by the kitchen talking and not doing anything.  Food was pretty good. I get the California Chicken Burger whenever I go. The chicken breast was verging on under cooked though I think. It had that texture that seemed like it was just barely cooked enough.  It made me a little nervous but I ate it anyway as the chicken was hot all way way through and the taste was pretty good. In hindsight I probably should have said something but I really didn't want a "special surprise" in my sandwich. :/ The fries are always good so I enjoyed those.  I don't think I'll be back to this location but now I know!

This location gets a 5/5. The waitstaff was very nice, the food was delicious, and the milkshake was spot on. Red Robin as a franchise is a bit overpriced for me. 10-15 for a burger, 6 for a milkshake, and a good tip is a bit much for me. That is why they are only getting 4 stars.  If you disagree with my second part and love red robin, then head to this location. You won't be disappointed. Enjoy!

Well it has been a week since I got sick. No call from Red Robin. The owner reached out last week over yelp and told me they'd reach out to me. I thought there was a chance of redemption, but nothing...
Best burger and fish place around.  At Red Robin by Everett Mall. You know food will be delicious and the service awesome.  I really love this place.

Fast and friendly. They will even make my 5 Alarm even though it's not on the menu anymore. Great place to celebrate a B-day or just have a fun day with the kids. What's not to love about bottomless fries?

I rarely give a 1 star review.  This was an occasion were I was in the process of it.  The manager actually seemed sincere when apologizing and owning it, so I am giving a 2.  I seriously go to Red Robin aat least 4 times a month in my current work schedule.  This was by far the worst visit.  I have had many recent great visits, in Portland and Tacoma. It took 9 minutes from when we sat down to be acknowledged, which then we would have had to look at menu and spend more time before eating.  Fortunately we have come enough that we knew what we wanted and just ordered then.... 27 minutes later (and after seeing others get their food) my wife asked wth was going on.  We were told they had computer issues, and it was coming right out (computer issues I guess only impacted some)... Then the food comes out and my wife's is messed up (bun instead of lettuce wraps).  They leave the fries which she eats prior to getting her burger (only took like 5 minutes or so). My avo-cobb-o salad was great as always and the cup of chili was decent.  However waiting 45 late at night, when we are already hungry, for a salad and a simple burger was horrible. The manager came and apologized (he knew we were pissed) and my wife's burger was comped.  That was nice of them, but seriously it is the time that was the issue. Due to the principal of ruining my night, I do not think we will go back there, or we will at least try not to.  We will still go back to Red Robin as there food is always good and they are usually consistent.  It is just too bad this is the most convenient location for us, and never really busy.

Let me start by stating that I never give a place 5 out of 5 stars. Simply because I like to believe that there is always room for improvement in naturally, anything that we do. Have it be making food, eating food, ordering food, anything. Period.  However, my most recent experience with the Red Robin located in Canyon Park was probably the nearest to a 5 star worthy review. If you're not hip to the holiday season, it is Christmas Eve. I work about 2 miles away and my boss was kind enough to want to provide lunch for our department. Knowing that a lot of my coworkers intend to leave early today, we decided that placing a lunch order at 11 AM would be sufficient. Yet it was then that we realized that Red Robin opened at 11 AM. OH NO! End of the world right? Wrong. Like many normal business practices, this facility is already loaded with employees eager to work on Christmas Eve. I called at 10:45 (I can't help my military nature. 15 prior to the 15 prior, hurry up and wait mindset) and was patched through to the Bartender. I informed her that I needed to place a take out order for a total of 17 people. She then had me speak with the main attraction of this review, the Manager , Maddie. Maddie was very friendly, kind, and most importantly, attentive. This was as easy as ordering a pizza from a mobile app. As a prior food service team member, I understand the daily frustrations of the industry. From the complicated orders, to the pressure of reassuring the customer that you will make sure this is done right. I held all the faith in the world in Maddie and her team. About 15 minutes later I had realized that an order was forgotten and it was quickly addressed with little to no hesitation. "No problem" seemed to be the words of the day.  What was most helpful was that when it got down to my order..... Man did I panic. I like to think I have a good concept of what I want. But after reading all these orders from my fellow coworkers, I had done it again. I became that indecisive customer. You know the type... I asked Maddie what her favorite was, in hopes of finding something to appease my mind, and stomach. She mentioned that her 12 years with the company, although helpful; only made matters worse. We finally arranged the perfect formula. It was a Guac Burger with mushrooms. The happy medium. I know that her and I see differently on the mushroom topic, but she's ok in my book. I even made the contingency that Maddie would need to hire me part-time if this order was in any way incorrect. With confidence, she agreed. I am sad to say, that I will keep my day job, and my day job only. At this time, I will not have the pleasure of working for Maddie. It was by far, one of the best interactions I have ever had at a restaurant. She made it easy, exciting, and fun.  My co workers had no gripes with their orders and all seemed pleased with the food. The soggy fries are no fault of Red Robin's, but the drive is to blame. It happens. They were at least warm. The only thing I found to be unpleasant was when I went to pick up the food. As I sat at the bar with my coworker awaiting the numerous bags. A blonde female from the restaurant side came over and asked the bartender if the to-go order was going to at least leave a tip. She mentioned that 10 percent should be expected. Many may not have heard this, however; the battle tested, combat ears of this veteran, did. I was quick to announce that she need not worry. I too was in the food industry and have a decent amount of respect for my fellow human. Either way, she would not receive the tip anyway. So it boggles my mind. I joked casually with the bartender about the situation and she was a real good sport about it. Aside from that, it was great. So in short, here is my closing statement about this place....  I would battle a wild bear outside my local McDonalds, caged in the handicap stall, with my hands tied behind my back, with a shake-weight super glued to my forehead as my only weapon for a chance to share a meal over skype - on a dial up connection with the employees of this place.    Thanks again Maddie. Keep it up!

Tonight I was seated and served cold fry's while waiting for food. 25 minutes after ordering food came and lukewarm. Enough said regarding my experience tonight. The server tried her best, unfortunately management not so much.. Disappointed with the whole experience tonight...

We got a great seat for dinner in the bar. Drinks and hamburgers. AWESOME food and service!  Ask for *Manda*. She was a great!  We always had drinks.  We got our hamburgers quickly. Thank you, Jordan! And desert was fabulous!  Definitely going back to Red Robin

It's Red Robin so it's a chain restaurant but still decent food. We were here for. Late night dinner so wanted something quick and fresh. Mike B was awesome, very friendly and make sure we had everything we needed. Thanks Mike!

I've been to a lot of different red robins. This one is decent, I got the mushroom burger without a bun. They also made a fresh batch of fries to make sure there was no cross contamination. Service was pretty good too.

Server took exceedingly long to come to our table and the food took twice as long.  Hostess and management did nothing about an obvious homeless man that came in a went straight to the bathroom.  Very loud.

So I have two young boys and I go to Red Robin because of the surroundings, not the food. The food is a step above Denny's at best. Service is ok but be prepared to have your ears ringing when you leave because of the all the screaming kids
They're one of the better franchise restaurants. I'm satisfied with their food and the prices are just right. Yummy place and I'll be back!!

This is an interesting Red Robin to say the least. The store has a very small layout to it and really does not have the energy most Red Robins have. It is located next to a Fred Meyer's but not much else is nearby that would draw traffic. The service was quick and personable but the checkout process was slow. The serving size of french fries was way to small (granted they are bottomless, but you have to wait to have them cook them and deliver them--- aka a money maker as many will order more drinks--). Overall I would skip this Red Robin in the future, way to many dining choices near by that are a better value, but if your in the mood for Red Robin, go to Woodinville.

Red Robin consistently delivers excellent service and really great food. As a vegetarian, I appreciate that they have two different types of veggie burgers (garden and Boca) and that you can add any of the huge selection of toppings you want. I am a fan of the 5 alarm and the whiskey river styles. The onion straws are delicious as are the fried jalapenos.  They recently added hummus and sweet potato fries to their menu, which is a great touch. I give Red Robin a 5 because it reaches this standard: If anyone recommends Red Robin for lunch or dinner, I never say, "no" and always look forward to the meal. And Red Robin has never dissapointed.  Prices are also very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food received.

I've literally never done a review before but this Red Robin is AWFUL. We live super close to this red robin so we've come here about 10 times. Every single time we have had to wait minimum 20-30 minutes for our food to come whether it's slow or busy. You can never track down your server and tonight was the 2nd time I've found food in my hair. Half the time they forget to put a gluten free bun on my daughters burger, and they never discount us for their mistakes. We are never coming here again.
Besides the rude tall female waitress who didn't believe my drivers license was me & kicking me out of the bar!! The burger I had later was good.

My friends and I stopped by here for dinner this evening. I ordered the Garden Burger with a Boca patty (because I dislike Gardenburgers), and we asked for our bill to be split two ways. The waitress said okay, and took our order.  When the food arrived, I noticed my burger had a Gardenburger patty, not a Boca. We had all ordered sauces on the side, and we only got one of them and ranch dressing (We didn't ask for Ranch.). They sent it back, and I received my Boca patty and we got our sauces. Not only was I unaware that it was a Boca because it looked exactly the same as the previous burger(Boca burgers are typically a dark brown), but it was very cold and oddly watery when I took a bite, so I sent it back again. I declined their offer to remake it or get me anything else since I have a bit of food-related anxiety and wanted to stick with something meatless. I was going to eat the fries, but they took those away as well as the burgers both times. From then on, the waitress ignored me and my other female friend. She brought a small basket of fries to the gentlemen at our table, and refilled only their water, despite me and my friend having less than half a glass each and theirs being nearly full. It seemed as if she knew she wouldn't get a tip from me and my friend (who was kindly covering my tab), so she was trying to get on our boyfriends' good sides. My friends noticed this, and we discussed it afterward. I always feel bad when I'm unable to tip, but I didn't feel as bad this time. She also did not split our tab as we had requested. We gave up, and just asked her to split it evenly between two of my friends, who were treating my boyfriend and me to dinner.  The star for the manager who was kind enough to inform me that they changed their patties a few months back and removed it from my friend's tab. Had I known they changed the patties, I would've stuck with an appetizer instead.
Best place for burgers! Getting my usual burger fix. Unusually quiet today. That's a good thing. Don't have to shout to talk to friends.  Here w friends.
Crispy chkn sandwich.  Can't ever go wrong.. first mud pie in over 10 years.. perfection.

This is our favorite location in the area, there rarely over crowded, the bartenders are great and the service is always awesome!  Josh is our favorite server, he always has great recommendations and always makes sure we get to take advantage of our Royal Rewards card deals when we're there!

Service was prompt, friendly and clean. They messed up my order and fixed the problem seamlessly. Josh is an amazing charismatic server. Food was great, environment was great, and it was clear they worked on keeping everything clean.  I have been to many RR restaurants and this is by far my favorite.

Did not take much time to seat us. But service was slow. No Wi-Fi. They have new Ziosk on table. Please avoid clicking games on it. If you click on it by mistake, they charge $4.99. Don't they know that there is something called cell phone for that? Also there is no way to login using loyalty account. You can only Register. Good part of it was paying the check. Food was nice. I liked their salad.
Every time I have ate here my soda tasted really weird like really watery and barely any flavor. Don't know what is up with that, but it kind of bugs me a lot.

The wife and I love the Whiskey River burger and chicken sandwich.  After a long week of bull we decided a date night to Red Robin was in order. We placed our drink order and got them very quickly and placed our dinner order as the drinks came. Ten minutes after our order wastaken 7 people sat in the big round booth behind us. They got their drinks and the waiter comes by and says our food is almost up and was there anything we needed. another ten minutes go by and two young girls sit on the other side of us and order their food right away. Ten min later their food shows up, I ask our waiter who is just finishing up a huge drink order on the third side of us what's going on and he says he doesn'tknow but is very disappointed in the  service we are getting. I go over to the kitchen and ask for the manager and he comes out I explain we've been waiting almost an hour and he says I was just about to get your food... Nothing like sorry, or i'll eat part, or anything... VERY disappointing that my new favorite restraint is no good. Lynwood is further away but I guess it'll have to do

I've been to Red Robins before, but this was my first time to this one. My friend and I both ordered (bottomless) root beer floats and we split an order of buffalo clucks n' fries.  Our server kept our floats coming, brought extra napkins and wet wipes for the buffalo sauce, and was just helpful all around. The food itself was delicious and I was stuffed at the end. Just a tip: if you get a bottomless root beer float, avoid eating a heavy meal!

I have to start by saying I love burgers and I can eat them everyday and anywhere , red robin is the place to go when craving a big filling , tasty and yet affordable , you can't beat the bottomless fries , service is decent but it can take a while to get the fries sometimes , if they can greet you with a basket of fries it would be my favorite place for sure

So this place is clean, friendly, has very attentive staff, and the food is good. I went with a group of friends after Sunday service and we were treated very kindly. I especially enjoyed the service we got. You don't imagine a fast food restaurant to be so nice to you but this place was. Overall the place is very casual. Come as you are, eat whatever, watch some sports and relax with a beer.  The food it tasty but its just a simple burger and fries kind of place. Great for summer break or a veg-out kind of day. Nothing too extraordinary though. I enjoy the jalopeno burger and the chicken veggie wrap. TIP: Ask for garlic fries. Otherwise, you'll just get regular side dish of fries. TIP: Upgrade from the root beer float, to a BEER-float, yum!

Had a lovely meal there recently - tried "The Berzerker", which initially seemed a little small, but didn't fail to satisfy in the end.  You could actually taste the beef in the burger, which was a nice change from a sauce-slathered patty from questionable origins.  This tasted like BEEF!  And who doesn't love those yummy stringy caramelized onions?  I would have liked a few more of them, like the advertisement shows, but oh well.  The ambiance was predictable, the service was adequate, but not memorable, the beer was cold and good.  'Nuff said.  Will be back again, since we've gone twice now and thoroughly enjoyed the food both times.

Despite having several great experiences here in the past, today's visit was horrible. The host was highly unpleasant and very rude to my mother. There was food under my chair. The restaurant had underwent a remodel since we were there last and it has reduced the dining area into an even more tightly packed and uncomfortably hot eating area. The restaurant had, apparently, decided to reduce their wait staff in favor of new machines that allows either younger, or more knowledgeable, customers to order and pay from their table, with a credit card. This was a big issue for us as it took at least 20 to 25 minutes for someone to acknowledge and wait on us. The person wasn't our server, but cared enough to help. She apologized and explained that there was reduced staff that day, a fact our primary Waitperson enhanced when he pointed out the new machines. The only complaint about the two waitpeople's joint service was that neither brought us water. My mother's burger was a little bland and somewhat smaller then it used to be. My own burger seemed to be about .50 to .75 cents more then it used to be and was slightly underwhelming.  The Campfire sauce and onion rings were good as always. I may go to another Red Robin in the future in the hopes that it wasn't remodelled and forced to lay off experienced waitstaff in exchange for the so called 'convenience' of the tabletop machines. As for this location, I may not be back.

My husband had been looking forward to bottomless rootbeer floats for weeks, however service was so slow that bottomless = 1 refill. We also had issues checking out, as we had been charged an entertainment fee, which was still on our  bill after the waitress told us she removed it. The waitress was nice, but overall this experience at Red Robin was my worst Red Robin experience ever. It was plagued with subpar food and an inability to refill just about anything without waiting at least 5 to 10 minutes (assuming they even ask).

I've always been a fan of the awesome food RR has! I've been coming to the Bothell location since it opened and have had amazing service in the bar each time! I can't speak for the restaurant itself, but for the bar - STAFF IS AMAZING! Love coming in on a weekend and not having to wait for a table usually. I always order the same thing: RR gourmet cheeseburger and is always pink at this location. Whenever I visit another location it is well-done. Though it is loud all the time, it has great staff, food, and service! The restroom and restaurant is always clean.

So I have this tiny little spot in my hardest of hearts for Red Robin.  It may be the neverending steak fries, but I'm not sure.  I've been to a lot of Red Robins in my day (many time)...Everett, Lynnwood, North Seattle, South Seattle, Seattle proper, Eastside RR, Woodinville RR....yeah I've run the RR gauntlet.   I was dragged here by family this past weekend and this is the worst RR I've ever been to.  Period.  Too noisy, inept staff, terrible food (seriously...you haven't been open long enough to suck yet!).  I will NOT NOT NOT be going back.   To this one.

Grow up my folks never took me to Red Robins , do the fact that my dad can grill any plant or animal and make taste great . So it was not until later in life that me , Lance and Bubba would to the Red Robins in Belleuve to drink  and sometimes eat too . Fast forward to present day Bubba moved back to NC , Lance is gone and I live Bothell , where I enjoy some great lunches and dinners at the  Red Robins in Bothell . They have great Burgers and Sandwiches , fun drinks too . They staff at that local are cheerful and very helpful . A cool thing is they are always adding new items to their menu , the only sad thing the apple crisp is done , they had the best
I've never been a huge fan of Red Robin. Overall this location is clean, friendly and close to my work.

I used to work for the Bird.  I read the handbook and am familiar with the service sequence. If my soda is still 3/4 full, you do not have to drop off another one.  I understand the concept of bottomless soda.  You do not have to demonstrate it.  Thanks for the thought though. I like the burgers at Red Robin, and I love the bottomless fries and ranch.  I adore their seasoning salt, but I'm a fan of MSG. This is a nice location situated in the perfect spot to welcome the urban sprawl.  I hope it succeeds because there will always be a soft spot in my heart for the Bird.
I like their Prime Rib Dip. Tried some other things, but the dip is the best.

OK, it's Red Robin, so there isn't much new I can say about the food. But the fact that it is in Bothell and right down the street from work makes it worthwhile to review. The few times I have eaten here, both the food and service were fine. The burgers tasted pretty much the same as other Red Robins, with the usual bonus of bottomless fries. However, what would make this location better is a happy hour, since Canyons has a near monopoly in the area. The bar area is large, but there is only one TV, and the customers were there basically to be seated earlier or to avoid the hoards of kids that can be there.

I have been a fan of the Big Red Bird for some time now. There is just something about bottomless steak fries and honey mustard that I can't say no to. I have always had good experiences with each location and I thought I would give this one a shot. I have to be honest, the service was terrible. Tables next to us received their food first. I could see our food sitting at the window getting cold. Honestly, I think our server stepped out and forgot to hand us off to another server. I voice my frustration to the manager and he was very quick to comp our meal and apologize. Don't get me wrong, I was happy to get the meal at no charge. But I was more impressed that the manager really seemed to care about our experience and genuinely felt bad. It is because of this that I will again visit this location.
We went back a couple of times after and the service people were nice but somewhat slow in getting our food still. What's up? The kitchen/cooks need to work on the speed.
Service is slow - mixed drinks taste watered down and I usually have to send them back to have them redone. The music is so dang loud, you can't carry on a conversation with the people at your table.

Consistent cookie cutter experience when you go in.  Food is decent if you stick to the burgers. Pr icy for what you get.  I just called multiple times to try and place a to-go order, but they don't answer their phone.  There are a lot better places if you are craving a great burger.  One pro is that you can take crying babies here and not feel bad about it. There are plenty of other crying babies, so one more wont hurt

Overall I'd recommend this place.  It's Red Robin, so if you have been to one, you've been to them all.  This one in Bothell is very new.  Staffing is typical younger kids, but we had decent service.  I still can't figure out why sometimes it takes 5-7 minutes to get my second basket of bottomless fries, but perhaps it is a sign I shouldn't be eating them.   This is a great place to take kids, which is why we sometimes hit RR.  Oh, and the Blue Ribbon Burger is the best one on the menu, in my opinion.

This was convenient because I lived so close, and I used to love RR in high school, so I ordered take out a few times. They DO NOT cook their meat all the way, and I actually throw up every time I eat a burger from here. I after three times trying that spread out over months I found fajitas on their menu, those were good... until they took them off the menu? Disgusting, I'll never be able to eat RR again.
GLUTEN FREE MENU. !!! Love the layout and the food is always top notch!!!

My daughter and I went here for lunch a couple of weeks ago..she really enjoys RR-loves their Garden Burger-it was straight up noon, and I wasn't going to try to get into the one by Everett Mall or Alderwood, so we decided to try this one, thinking it wouldn't be as crowded.  We were right.  The food was ok...the service ok..but the noise level was over the top..LOTs and LOTs of little kids...I mean toddlers, and younger, probably all fussy cuz it's lunch time...it was just really distracting, and took away from the whole experience.  It was a great commercial for Birth Control...couldn't wait to get outta there.

It's been about 10 years since I've been to a Red Robin. It use to be my usual weekly go to place and I actually liked going there. I went with a party of 9 and it took forever to get the order taken, to get our food and finally to get the bill! We were there for 1 1/2 hrs and were exhausted by the time we left! Service sucked, the food was OK. I had a bacon cheeseburger and it was not as good as what I can get at my favorite burger place- Shake-N-Go by the Lynnwood Convention center.

I called ahead and spoke to the manager... are they are 'food allergy friendly?'  He was very nice and said they could even print out a special menu.  Very cool!   The staff were smiling and happy to be there.  I asked our waiter about the 'special menu' and took the time to print it out.  He was very polite and shared my concern about the food allergy.  The kitchen also used a different colored basket to avoid any cross contamination mistakes.  The kids devoured their food and I could relax and listen to their happy chatter.  We have been craving big juicy burgers and lemonade for awhile and was perfect!  This Red Robin has a great attitude and did a fantastic job with our special request.  Call ahead and ask :)  The kids keep singing the Rrrrred Robin.. Yum!  :)
Burgers are good and the times we have went the service is OK.

we had been to Red Robin couple of times. The food was average but the service was bad! the last time we were there, we could not stay for long as our one year old was cranky and we had to leave without eating. We put the food in boxes and left. As we got into the car, we realised that we forgot the boxes at the table where we were seated. We went back and the table was cleared and on asking the hostess, we are 'informed' that the policy is to dispose everything on the table once the customer leaves!  Surprising! it took us 2minutes to return! So we had to pay for all that food and have nothing to eat! we vowed never to return and had to have some lunch elsewhere! Bye Bye Red Robin - never flying your way again.. I wish there was option for rating 'zero' star- red robin would get that from me for their service!

It just opened this week. Arrive with our child. We were told 10 -15 minutes within 5 minutes we were seated. It was around 1 :00 pm and the place was packed. It is kid friendly. Our waitress was very nice and fast taking orders, napkins, etc.  Our drinks were served fast and the food also. I just found out that burgers have bottomless steak fries. I was full and no need of more , but all the time I have been in other Red Robins and today in this new place they never ask you" Do you want more fires'?. Next time I will ask for more fries. So that is why I am giving one star, they should remind you about the bottomless steak fries.

My wife thought this would be a safe bet because the location in Bellingham is pretty OK.  Unfortunately this is not the case here.   Waitress brought me the first flat coke I have had in 10 years, I asked her if other drinks might have more carbonation in tank, she told me they have more than one  coke dispenser. Promised to return with  carbonated coke from a different machine, moments later she came back with another flat coke?  - I gave up and drank it.  Ketchup bottle on table was empty - wife had to retrieve one for us. No forks, spoon or knives were on table - none were offered. After eating half my meal and I was able to wave the waitress down with my sticky hands and have her bring us napkins that were never provided.   The fry's which were listed as BOTTOMLESS, were provided in very very skimpy proportions, after we were already done eating, my wife managed to get the disinterested waitress to bring us another serving, I guess she thought we should split one and came back with what looked like 12 french fry's, by design we felt like  we would look like pigs for requesting yet another serving so we cut our losses and  asked for the bill.    We won't be going back to this location, but I wouldn't throw out Red Robin as a whole, it appears to be a location problem.
As as the red robins everywhere, pbviously. This one is well kept (clean) and the staff are friendly and up to date on menu changes. We visit a couple times a month or so.

I do enjoy this place. In fact I enjoy just about every RR I have ever visited. However this place in particular is the joint. Always hopping, the game is always on, staff is super friendly and helpful. Like all RR it's a little on the pricy side, like 15-20 bucks for a burger, but at least it's a good burger. Would recommend for families, groups of friends , or just to kick back and enjoy a beer by ones self.

Honestly you get what you pay for. I order to-go I always tip so of course my customer service gets way better after paying. I get it though. The burgers are less than $11 with a heap of fries. For the price it's a great deal.
Great food and servers but the slowest kitchen in the world! I wouldn't recommend coming here if you are in a hurry.

Terrible carry out service! The restaurant "lost" our order!  I called in for take out at 6:30, was told it would take a half hour.  I arrived a little after 7:00.  Someone at the bar took my payment, said they were busy that night, so it would be a little longer.  30 minutes later,  I still didn't get my food.  When I asked for a refund, the manager offered to check on the order. They somehow lost my order in the kitchen.  We won't be doing take out there anymore!

One of my top choices for places to eat! Always good food! Always great service! The one weird thing that I have is the consistency of some of their dishes. Ordered the wings they have on their appetizer menu and have received different items with it each time... This isn't huge just kind of weird! Still amazing food!

Why am I waiting 15 minutes for a table when there are literally 10 empty tables? Weak. I'm editing this because our server was great. Mike was his name and he was really, really good. kids loved him and he really redeemed poor management of the flow of people.
Rudest manager I have ever met in my life will NEVER return - Burger frozen order messed up took forever manager implied it was our fault as we had a large party. Sad what happened to Red Robin?

Still a poor quality restaurant. I decided to go here again, because I thought maybe I was too hasty to write the previous review, but was I WRONG! The drinks seemed to be watered down. When you pay $5 for a beer, you really wouldn't expect it to be skunky and watered down right? The fries were still bad, maybe hire somebody with a G.E.D. instead of a 5th Grade Education, so they can read you have to cook fries for 5 minutes at 480 degrees, rather than cooking it for 500 seconds at 48 degrees. Who cooks the burgers? The newly hired 15 year old binge drinker that can't tell the difference between a man and a woman? Must be, when I asked for no lettuce, I get extra lettuce. Go to your local Hope Link and get food there. It's a lot better than this crap!

Haven't been to a red robin in a while since it has proven very disappointing in past years. This experience turned that around. Out waitress Jasmine was excellent. Very friendly and knowledgable. Everything came out fast and perfect. I went with her suggestions and will most definitely be back to sit in her section and see what else the new menu has to offer!! Good job in turning things around and you better do what you can to keep her around!
Mediocre at best. Small restaurant; slow waiters, seated right next to a loud ass table. Waiters name is Lisa. Too small of a dining area.
My last experience in here wasn't the greatest considering we literally waited almost an HOUR for our food and the waiter did nothing about it. Not even taking our drinks off. very disappointing...
I've never been to such a horrible chain location! TERRIBLE service, cold fries, burnt burgers.

Usually our experiences at Red Robin are the same...quick service, decent food, great place for kids. This was my first time back since the recent fire and I can say it will be a long time before I come back. All but my husband's food was cold....as in the kids both got grilled cheese and the cheese was not melted. It was very odd and not like usual. Not sure if a new cook or what but it felt like it was made and sat out for a long time (which jives with how long we had to wait). Even getting our server to our table initially took a good 15 mins so maybe they just have new staff or something but it was disappointing :(

Hostess was very polite and nice, server was the tablet on my table. There was a guy named Collin who said he was our server. I mistakenly took this to believe he would perhaps refill drinks or perhaps grab boxes for the table. Instead we sat for twenty minutes with a stupid tablet that was assigned to a different table waiting to e-pay a check. A few other things, kitchen staff shouldn't be in sweatpants(it's a restaurant not a jerkoff den) and it might be a good idea to wipe down tables when guests leave; and maybe push them from the the walkways. Horrible service, good food. Good thing Applebee's exists

Good food. Kind of slow service tonight. I wish they would bring back the rajun Cajun chicken sandwich that was my favorite.  Why does yelp mobile keep telling me my reviews are shorter than most? It is a restaraunt and I just want to say if the food is good or not good. Its good. When I come up with my grand ode de la pickle I'll publish it as an Amazon eBook I won't post it to yelp for them to benefit from for free!

Two-blocks from my house, and I love Red Robin... I find the nearest Red Robin when I want a burger because it's soo good.  This Red Robin location opened up not to long ago and I hate to say this, but the customer service isn't as good as the Bellevue or the Lynnwood location. I would rather take the drive to Lynnwood or even Bellevue then going to the Bothell location. Food is still good though...

I love Red Robin and so does my Fiance but this place 99% of the time has terrible service and especially in the bar. I now refuse to sit in the bar, everytime we have our food was wrong and the service was terrible. Now the dining area is starting to get bad as well. We went a couple days ago and it took 10 minutes for the waiter to come to the table just to greet us even though they ALL saw us sitting there. Our drinks were never refilled and overall just not good.  We wil be going to Alderwood Mall for the future Red Robin dinners.
Traveling from southern California. Needed good reliable lunch. Service was good and food tasty. Overall good choice. Menu has plenty of options for everyone.

It's Saturday night, we called ahead because we were a large party of 8 with 5 kids.  "we don't do reservations" they said, but took down our name, for a heads up a guess.. We got to the restaurant and was told there would be a half hour wait, not surprising being Saturday night, while waiting you can't escape the noise of this place it is annoyingly loud and very crammed the waiting area is way to small, it's standing room only. We waited 35 minutes, went to check they said they were waiting for the folks at the large table to leave and that if we wanted they would set up two tables for us, one for the kids and one for the adults, rather than continuing to wait we opted for this option, sofar so good this is working our great the kids can fend for themselves!! Btw ages 12,10,8 and 2 the 8 month old Is with us. Just finished dinner, the service was good, food tasted great and came out fast, I tried a new burger the "loveburger" has fried jalapeños that add a nice spice! We all had full bellies, the price was fair, and the kids had fun. Overall 4 star experience!

the loudest and worst of all the red robins I have ever been too. Food is what you expect from Red Robin, Good but not great but inexpensive. I don't like going to this one during the dinner time, as it's been designed like Century Link stadium... IT'S TOO LOUD!!!!!!!! Way Way too loud for some reason. I don't know...
