I go to this one cuz of the convenience of it's locale and that is the only reason.
You can order your food and then ho pick up and it nice and hot amd they have zesty sauce mmmmmgood
They have a new awesome happy hour. A variety of appetizers ranging from 2$ to 5$ Burning love burger was as good as ever. My fav burger joint! Make sure to get their new rewards card!

Ouiet Sunday night.  I ordered the clam strips  Very healthy portions.  My wife had lettuce wrapped burger (cuts down on the bread she eats) and the bottomless root beer float.  Service was a little slow (had to get my own ice tea from a pitcher by the bar).  No real complaints.
Pros: -Clean -Good Service  -Cheap drinks -Good Salads Cons: -Burgers are sub par (isn't that the point of the place) Drive to Ranch, Blooming Onion, or hell, even Micky D's.

really disappointing service. The wait staff here is slower than molasses going up hill on a cold day. They can be very friendly, then can be as warm and inviting as a wet blanket. The food is the same quality you expect from Red Robin anywhere, when the servers can punch in your order correctly. On four separate occasions I have spoken to managers and everytime they have bent over backwards and sent me out a gift card. How many gift cards must they send out for crappy service before they realize their wait staff are idiots?

Red Robin is certainly not gourmet, but it can get the job done.  I never really feel satisfied afterwards though.  The service here is great, but the food is greasy and not fresh tasting.  I'm being generous with 3 stars today.

Red robin is red robin. It's straight to the point. Hit or miss with this place honestly all they care about is money. Eat you're food and get out. My boyfriend and I went to have lunch and I came in 1st to get a table while he was finding a parking spot. While he was doing that I got a table quickly. I saw my server once! She got our drinks and by the time he came in we had our drinks. (Note he never met our server). So after looking at the menu I had to find a server or someone to take our order. They didn't know where I server went. We ate and someone else brought us the check. We paid and left $1 tip (shouldn't left anything). I forgot our receipt so I went back literally we just left the tip was gone but our receipt was still there. I  was so pissed. The worst customer service ever!!

Simply stated...The new Tavern 6.99 burger is complete garbage.  All of the Fast food restaurants around the area are better.  Even DQueen.  Lackluster, Bland, Missing toppings, Small, crappy.. Very disappointed. VERY!
Been here a few times. Good food. Good customer service. General standard prices for a restaurant. If in the area I would go back.

I'm obsessed with the chilli-con-queso dip. Infact when I go there, that's all I really need. They serve these giant fried-pita-esque chips with it... only comes with 4 and the rest are plain jane tortilla chips. Asked the nice bartender for more of the giant ones, ask and you shall receive! Yum! Go here for happy hour, decent cheap appetizers (my queso dip drops to like $3 [regular $5]).
Good service with a great attitude and consistently prepared sandwiches are great.  The prices are fair.

Highs: Service (Rebecca was her name, excellent waitperson!) Space (the bar, size-wise, much better layout than Everett) Happy Hour drink prices Lows: Not enough TVs and fairly small screens Can't seem to get "well done" no matter how you ask Coming from the north, tough to get into the parking lot whether you are manuevering through Freddies or entering from B/E Hwy.
Flipping horrible. Mangers a drunk, waitresses are high and the food is always messed up and or has a hair in it. My fault for always going back...learned my lesson

Join their Red Royalty Club..... Good benefits!  But all in all a very regular family chain.  They took a lot of old favorites off the menu and are consistently changing things up.  If you have kids a good place to visit.  I will stop in periodically for their Southwest Salad on my lunch hour.
Food isn't bad and the service was pretty good.  BUT THE KIDS!!  OMG it was like being at Chuck E Cheese.  Won't be back any time soon.
I'm not a fan of RR, but occasionally my wife desires big greasy burgers...  RR has big greasy burgers, so it meets my needs.

Star - You are close to my work.  Star - You allow me to make it a Boca burger. The annoying clap clap clap clap happy happy happy birthday clap clap clap...  I'm sitting in the bar to get away from that freak show!  I hate Red Robin! I'll be back.

I went here on my birthday, just because I signed up for their e-club to get a free birthday burger.  (Nice perk, by the way.  A $10 burger for free?  Can't beat that.  Seriously.) The service was pretty good, I can't complain.  They did find out it was my birthday though & sang their little spiel to me.  I got a free sundae out of it though.  (Again, no complaints here for that.)  I guess I can confess that it was nice to have my birthday recognized.  Just because the older you get, the least people really give a crap. I had the Bonzai Burger.  It is messy as all hell, but it was still pretty good.  We also ordered the Onion Rings as an appetizer.  They were good too.  Nice & crispy, and i love their spicy thousand island sauce or whatever the heck it is that they serve with it. My 1 year old son came with me for this particular birthday luncheon with former coworkers.  I do like the fact that Red Robin is kid friendly.  They were very nice to my little guy.  I appreciated that. I will definitely go back again next year for my free burger!  ; )

Not impressed.  The food is fine-but the service sucked.  We saw our server twice the whole night.  The place is too new to have such crappy service, and all the servers tonight were bad.  Obviously a sign of poor management.  And yeah-still out of balloons for the kids.

My family and I were there a couple of weeks ago.  We stood unattended at the front waiting for a table for almost 10 minutes while employees walked by and two of them stood at the front seemingly unaware of our presence (we are a family of 5 with a two year old!)!  We finally get seated, the host puts our menus on the table without greeting us or telling us that a server will be on his/her way.  We wait almost 15 minutes while employees walk by chitchatting including our server who glances at us several times but doesn't bother to apologize for the wait!  It takes almost half an hour for our food to arrive!  We ordered 2 burgers and 2 kids meals and the place was slow -- only 3 other tables in our section and a couple of people at the bar.  The food was forgettable, could've had better at a Denny's or Shari's!  The staff needs some serious training in customer service!  We will not be returning to this establishment again.
